alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 20 at 2:22PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM HST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE ISLAND OF HAWAII IN HAWAII COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County. * WHEN...Until 345 PM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 220 PM HST, radar and automated gauges indicated persistent moderate rainfall falling at rates of up to 1 inch per hour along slopes of the Hilo, Puna and Kau Districts, though most streams have shown little to moderate increase in stream flow during the past hour. In addition, spotty heavy showers across leeward Big Island have diminished. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... the entire island of Hawaii. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 345 PM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
